result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto C Villarreal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Any placement with children will be in compliance with family court orders.

timeConds.notes: 45 days STAYED with 45 days to serve upfront with Huber for employment and or treatment. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto C Villarreal

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 10-28-22 @10:37

9:25 AM Defendant Roberto C Villarreal in court.  Attorney David Saldana in court for Roberto C Villarreal.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: GUILTY. 
State requests to take a break so that she can download a video she wishes to play for sentencing. 
Parties go off the record. Back on the record at 10:12am with same appearances as above. 
State shows video to Court. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
Sentence withheld. 
18 months probation.

Conditions of probation:
90 days Racine County Jail 45 days stayed with 45 days to serve with Huber for employment and treatment report in 11/15/22 at 8:30am. 
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
Any placement will be in compliance with family court orders. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge
